intro: Ruellia albicans, commonly known as white ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially sunny environments. Ruellia albicans is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in horticulture for its attractive foliage and blooms.
